info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 19 at 5:47PM EDT until July 19 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
At 547 PM EDT, Trained weather spotters reported flash flooding across the warned area, especially in the area of a trailer park near the intersection of Route 58 and Glendale Road. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain.
SOURCE...Trained spotters reported.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Galax... Fries... Pipers Gap... Woodlawn...
This includes the following streams and drainages... Little Reed Island Creek, Elk Creek, New River, Crooked Creek, East Fork Crooked Creek, Dixon Branch, Bull Run, Glady Fork, Meadow Creek, Little Cranberry Creek, Chestnut Creek and Mill Creek.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN CARROLL AND EAST CENTRAL GRAYSON COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF GALAX

area.areaDesc: Carroll, VA; Grayson, VA; City of Galax, VA
